results.title: Metformin reduces proteinuria in spontaneously hypertensive rats by activating the HIF-2alpha-VEGF-A pathway.
results.text_hl: We determined the role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ and investigated the mechanism.

citations.NLM: Liu T, Hong L, Yang Y, Qiao X, Cai W, Zhong M, Wang M, Zheng Z, Fu Y. Metformin reduces proteinuria in spontaneously hypertensive rats by activating the HIF-2alpha-VEGF-A pathway. Eur J Pharmacol. 2021 Jan 15;891():173731. PMID: 33220275

results.title: Metformin ameliorates the severity of experimental Alport syndrome
results.text_hl: Although @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ was more suppressive on @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ than @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ also significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@.

citations.NLM: Omachi K, Kaseda S, Yokota T, Kamura M, Teramoto K, Kuwazuru J, Kojima H, Nohara H, Koyama K, Ohtsuki S, Misumi S, Takeo T, Nakagata N, Li JD, Shuto T, Suico MA, Miner JH, Kai H. Metformin ameliorates the severity of experimental Alport syndrome Sci Rep. 2021 Mar 29;11(1):7053. PMID: 33782421

results.title: Prevalence of proteinuria and its associated factors in hypertensive diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: In contrast to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (OR=0.237; 95% CI: 0.098-0.572; p<0.01), @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who received @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ (OR=1.992; 95% CI: 1.136-3.492; p<0.05), @CHEMICAL_Thiazides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D049971 @@@thiazide@@@ diuretics (OR=1.848; 95% CI: 1.108-3.083; p<0.05), calcium channel blockers (OR=1.833, 95% CI: 1.110-3.028, p<0.05), or beta-blockers (BBs) (OR=2.199, 95% CI: 1.257-3.848, p<0.01) had a higher likelihood of having @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@.

citations.NLM: Jarab AS, Al-Qerem W, Alzoubi KH, Alqudah S, Abu Heshmeh SR, Mukattash T, Al-Azzam S, Naser YA, Alkhatatbeh M. Prevalence of proteinuria and its associated factors in hypertensive diabetic patients. Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci. 2024 Jan;28(1):155-162. PMID: 38235867
citations.BibTeX: @article{38235867, title={Prevalence of proteinuria and its associated factors in hypertensive diabetic patients.}, author={Jarab AS and Al-Qerem W and Alzoubi KH and Alqudah S and Abu Heshmeh SR and Mukattash T and Al-Azzam S and Naser YA and Alkhatatbeh M}, journal={Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci}, volume={28}, number={1}, pages={155-162}}

results.title: The effects of metformin on inflammation and apoptosis in rats with preeclampsia.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ in @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@PE@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ ameliorated @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, altered the expression of @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@PE@@@ biomarkers, and significantly inhibited @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L-NAME@@@-induced @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ and cell apoptosis.

citations.NLM: Chen Y, Gao Z, Wang L, Duan R, Hao H, Jia R, Ma H, Gao R, Su M, Yang H, Tu Z. The effects of metformin on inflammation and apoptosis in rats with preeclampsia. J Hypertens. 2024 Oct 2;():. PMID: 39351873

results.title: Metformin attenuates endoplasmic reticulum stress in diabetic kidney disease: mechanistic insights and future perspectives.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ attenuates endoplasmic reticulum stress in @DISEASE_Diabetic_Nephropathies @DISEASE_MESH:D003928 @@@diabetic kidney disease@@@: mechanistic insights and future perspectives.

results.title: Protective effect of metformin on the NG-nitro-l-arginine methyl ester (l-NAME)-induced rat models of preeclampsia.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The study findings demonstrate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ administration improves blood pressure and 24-h @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, alleviates fetal @DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@growth restriction@@@, ameliorate @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ cytokines, and restores the balance of angiogenic factors and endothelial function.

citations.NLM: Hao H, Li F, Wang F, Ran J, Chen Y, Yang L, Ma H, Wang J, Yang H. Protective effect of metformin on the NG-nitro-l-arginine methyl ester (l-NAME)-induced rat models of preeclampsia. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2024 Nov 13;739():150996. PMID: 39550868

results.title: Metformin Versus Standard of Care in Patients with Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease - A Randomized Control Trial.
results.text_hl: Baseline characteristics were distributed equally across randomized groups. Baseline @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ was significantly higher in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ arm (p = 0.014).

citations.NLM: Venkatasubramanian V, Sethi J, Kumar V, Yadav AK, Lal A, Kohli HS. Metformin Versus Standard of Care in Patients with Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease - A Randomized Control Trial. Indian J Nephrol. 2025 May-Jun;35(3):410-416. PMID: 40352872

results.title: Metformin enhances the immunomodulatory potential of adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells through STAT1 in an animal model of lupus.
results.text_hl: Administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-treated Ad-MSCs resulted in significant disease activity improvement including @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ phenotype, @DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulonephritis@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ and anti-dsDNA IgG antibody production in @CELLLINE_CVCL:B6HA @@@MRL/lpr@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Jang SG, Lee J, Hong SM, Kwok SK, Cho ML, Park SH. Metformin enhances the immunomodulatory potential of adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells through STAT1 in an animal model of lupus. Rheumatology (Oxford). 2020 Jun 1;59(6):1426-1438. PMID: 31904843

results.title: Metformin reduces insulin resistance and attenuates progressive renal injury in prepubertal obese Dahl salt-sensitive rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@Proteinuria@@@ was significantly greater in SSLepRmutant rats versus SS rats throughout the study, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ in SSLepRmutant rats.

results.title: Clinical Characteristics and Prevalence of Comorbidities according to Metformin Use in Korean Patients with Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: Tables 4 and 5 show the prevalence of macro- and microvascular complications of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ according to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use. While no significant difference was observed in macrovascular complications according to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use (Table 4), the prevalence of @DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@diabetic retinopathy@@@, @DISEASE_Cataract @DISEASE_MESH:D002386 @@@cataracts@@@, overt @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal insufficiency@@@ (estimated glomerular filtration rate < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2), and @DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral neuropathy@@@ was lower in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ user group (Table 5).

citations.NLM: Chin SO, Ha IG, Rhee SY, Jeong SJ, Chon S, Kim SH, Ahn KJ, Baik SH, Park Y, Nam MS, Lee KW, Woo JT. Clinical Characteristics and Prevalence of Comorbidities according to Metformin Use in Korean Patients with Type 2 Diabetes Int J Endocrinol. 2020;2020():9879517. PMID: 32774367
